website_summaries.verdict: Aside from a few quirks, this is a durable, adjustable kneeling chair that is comfortable for most.
pros: Offers a sturdy build and is easy to assemble even though it comes with sparse instructions
cons: Castors occasionally lock or don't move smoothly
Some owners say that it doesn't ease their knee pain

website_summaries.verdict: A deluxe ergonomic stool that boasts a curved seat and provides exceptional comfort and support.
pros: Seat cushion is angled at a comfortable 90° angle
Metal base ensures the stool is constructed to last
Seat height is adjustable up to 28"
Helps distribute weight evenly throughout the buttocks and legs to keep the spine aligned
cons: Stool's seat and shin/knee pads offer minimal padding, which can make it tough to sit comfortably for an extended period of time

customer_reviews.title: Train yourself to kneel, before zod...
customer_reviews.text: I'm 225lbs solid dude, back was killing me. Got this chair, took me a week or so to build up the muscles in my shins to get used to the new weight distribution, my pain is GONE. Love this chair, plan on getting a fancier one down the road, but I'm very happy with this.
customer_reviews.author: AHR_Artist

customer_reviews.title: Review from the perspective of my...
customer_reviews.text: Some micro-reviews of the chair from the perspective of my... - Back: Healthier than the lazy slouching position I defaulted to in my regular chair. - Bottom: More comfortable than regular chair. - Knees: More comfortable than old kneeling chair (2005-ish). - Eyes: Epitome of kneeling-chair design. - Ego: Kneeling is cool, right? - Brain: Self-impressed by feats of assembly (about 20 minutes from box opening to kneeling, excluding the week of procrastination) - Overall Health: Kneeling with good back posture can get too comfortable -- set a 30-minute reminder to change sit/stand desk to standing position, and back.
customer_reviews.author: Al Fresca

customer_reviews.title: Better than the Sleekform chairs
customer_reviews.text: Better than the Sleekform chairs. This chair has the tilted seat which you need to truly benefit from a kneeling style chair. It is also adjustable both on the seat height on the knee height making it highly customizable for people short and tall. I have chronic hip and lower back pain despite being young and healthy and this has saved me when I need to sit and work at the computer. I have a standing desk with a balance board as well but you can't stand all day or for some kinds of work, so this chair has been great.
customer_reviews.author: Jaime Bauer

customer_reviews.title: He has only been using it one week but his back is feeling better and as a bonus he says he can feel ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my husband to use at work. He has a standing desk but also sits about 3 hours a day. He has had 5 back surgeries and sitting at a desk causes a lot of pain. He loves this chair! He has only been using it one week but his back is feeling better and as a bonus he says he can feel it working his core a little. The chair has nice thick padding and it was easy to put together. I put it together by myself.
customer_reviews.author: LB

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and Functional
customer_reviews.text: Sitting at this chair as I write this review. I love it! The chair is perfect for work and slides easily under my desk when not in use. There is significantly less pressure on my lower back when kneeling than when sitting in a conventional office chair. The padding for the knees/shins is thick enough to allow me to sit for about two hours before my shins begin to get a little sore, but honestly I enjoy that. It's a great reminder to get up and walk around every few hours, even when in the heat of the work day. Sturdy craftsmanship. Arrived promptly and in excellent condition. Would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Rowan Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Rescues my back, so glad I bought it!
customer_reviews.text: This chair rescues me from the misery of back pain. I have a chronic back pain that when it's acute I cannot stand straight or after sitting in a conventional chair I have a hard time walking. This chair eliminates the latter situation and gives me a relief when I cannot get comfortable in any other position. I like the relief that this chair gives me so much that I bought a second one for my office outside of the house. The assembly was easy, though a second pair of hands for holding things as one assembles is really helpful. My husband was that extra pair of hands, and we were done with the assembly in about 15 mins.
customer_reviews.author: Katerina

customer_reviews.title: Beware of how you distribute your weight
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put together, is comfortable and both seat and shin/knee pads seem to have enough padding. However, the 2nd day I used it, the right knee pad completely "snapped" under my weight as I was sitting down. Granted, I only weigh 180 lbs. and this is rated for 300 lbs. Perhaps you need to "gingerly" come down on the pads (use the desk as support) or either I got a weak /defective support structure.
customer_reviews.author: jeff

customer_reviews.title: Seat to Knee rest ratio not good.
customer_reviews.text: Not good for this 5/2 woman, in good shape. I found that when I adjusted the height of the seat, it changed the angle of how your knees hit the rest. If the seat was high enough to be at its highest (23"), it changed seat to knee angle and placed so there was a LOT of pressure on my knees. If it was as low as the picture on the Amazon display, it's great for knees but the seat's too low to meet my desk. If I could somehow raise both the knee AND seat rest, it would be great. The directions were difficult and, if there's a way to do this, I certainly couldn't figure it out!
customer_reviews.author: Poodlemom

customer_reviews.title: easy to assemble and very adjustable for my 5'0" height
customer_reviews.text: Well made, easy to assemble and very adjustable for my 5'0" height!!! Loved the extra cushioning on the seat and kneeling pad. I had purchases a similar product years ago which failed miserably due to the fact that it was not height adjustable and that the cushioning was limited to a thin pad. Love it!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Slant of seat was OFF THE SCALE UNCOMFORTABLE
customer_reviews.text: Don't buy this chair! I used a kneeling chair at work for last 20 years of my career, but discarded it upon retiring. I decided to begin writing again SO opted to purchase a new kneeling chair. I chose this one based on customer ratings. But, folks, this chair is simply ill-conceived and not useable for more than half an hour. The cushion covering is sticky and way too thick and the seat itself is uncomfortably slanted, putting too, too much pressure on the knees. Right now, the chair sits in a closet, but I'm thinking of taking a knife to it to whittle down the cushion, making it flatter and more ergonomic. Too expensive for the benefit it provides.
customer_reviews.author: Usaa Platinum

customer_reviews.title: Did not perform as hoped.
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like this chair. I had high hopes that I had found a product that would allow me the opportunity to sit for extended hours pain free. Unfortunately after much seat adjustment, this chair still sustained my back pain. Plus it caused my feet to fall asleep and additional knee pain. I have scoliosis and degenerative arthritis of the spine; I have used these kneel type chairs in the past with much success, this chair however will be returned.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: BAD PRODUCT AND BAD ASSEMBLY INSTRUCTIONS
customer_reviews.text: product is a pain to adjust and doesn't swivel worth a darn. also assembly instructions need to clearly differentiate between locking and non locking wheels in parts list and direct assembler to put locking wheels in front. otherwise you will constantly accidently lock the wheels with your feet if they are in the back. and once in you can't change them out. i will look for a better kneeling chair that swivels better and who cares about locking wheels.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy Logan

customer_reviews.title: Seems like a good chair but not a fit for short person
customer_reviews.text: The chair appeared well made and would have been useful if I were a few inches taller. I am 5'1" and could not place my knees and calves as with comfort. I felt pressure and stress from trying to use the chair. Assembly was easy (as mostly was taking it apart to return it.) I would recommend trying it if you are somewhat taller than I am or have longer legs. I am long torso compared to my leg length. I can't rate all features as for me I would have to give 1's and think it might have been good if I fit it better.
customer_reviews.author: Fiona Cat

customer_reviews.title: Posture Perfecter and Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I really enjoyed this product because immediately my posture was perfected. Sitting up straight is something that everyone who works a desk job struggles with. It seems as if back aches and poor posture have become just part of life. This chair fixed that issue completely. On day 1, everyone took turns and had the same reaction of "Wow! So this is how your back and posture is supposed to feel." I would highly recommend this product to anyone who sits in a desk daily.
customer_reviews.author: Fiona McKenna

customer_reviews.title: Awesome in the salon!
customer_reviews.text: I'm a manicurist and I love this chair! My work can really do a number on my upper back, shoulders and neck. I was able to tell a huge difference after the first week of use...Id definitely recommend this chair for anyone sitting at a desk for periods of time!
customer_reviews.author: Mo

customer_reviews.title: I love this chair!
customer_reviews.text: Due to lower back issues/disk herniations/annular tears/arthritis, sitting is quite uncomfortable for me. I can stand all day, but only sit for a limited amount of time. Enter this ergonomic kneeling chair. This allows me to "sit" comfortably for long periods of time. I do find it necessary to get up and move every 20 minutes or so, but this is just a good practice in general.
customer_reviews.author: haley

customer_reviews.title: I thought I'd love it, but then didn't feel comfortable at all ...
customer_reviews.text: It was stopping my blood circulation. Probably it is just me. I thought I'd love it, but then didn't feel comfortable at all to have my legs under me. I really wished I could sit on the seating area but extend my legs down more like on a bar chair. That would have been so much better. I tried that too but the knee thingy is on the way.
customer_reviews.author: MsD

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t help back pain. Hurts legs too.
customer_reviews.text: I am active, workout 3x a week but still have lower back pain From sitting all day. I thought this would help based on the reviews. Instead it made my back pain worse and additionally hurt my legs. It only adjusts to two positions (and not easy assembly) so at the tallest position (I’m 5’7” and 125lbs) my feet were in the ground and It was uncomfortable. I returned this. Rotating between a regular chair and an exercise ball now which is much better.
customer_reviews.author: M.LP

customer_reviews.title: The product itself tries to be as soft and comfortable as possible
customer_reviews.text: It works the way you would expect. The product itself tries to be as soft and comfortable as possible. But it's debatable whether the form factor of any kneeling chair (not just this kneeling chair) is more ergonomic because they will eventually get uncomfortable after many hours. But, it is true that sitting in any type of chair (even a traditional chair) for an extended period of time will eventually get uncomfortable. I like to have this kneeling option because it allows me to alternate between this chair and a traditional chair once a day.
customer_reviews.author: Tom M.

customer_reviews.title: Takes some getting used to but overall a great investment.
customer_reviews.text: Overall this is a great investment - it improved my posture over time, and broke up the monotony of sitting in the same old office chair. It provided some relief for bum soreness but introduced some tension in the knees and shins - a decent trade off. I use this for about half the day, most days. However, one very important detail, is that this chair will NOT transform you into a dragon and grant you the Draconic ancestry traits or abilities. Disappointing, I know.
customer_reviews.author: BadTactic

customer_reviews.title: Great Product at Reasonable Price
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble (although I didn't notice that only 2-wheels had locks, and I had put them both on the same side ... not really a problem); very comfortable; I'm 6' and the height is fine for me, (although I already had my computer screen slightly raised); comfortable typing position. Helps out with sitting posture (my main goal).
customer_reviews.author: TexasMike

customer_reviews.title: I really want to like it
customer_reviews.text: This is my second chair of this type I have purchased. I really want to like it as it saves on space and helps with posture. I can't get past the pain in my knees and legs when sitting here for a while. I figured this chair would be nice for me for my computer gaming sessions to help me maintain good posture but it feels like using it I'd trade my knees for my back posture. I'm 5'11" 190 lbs athletic built and I've tried several different setting to adjust it at and I still can't be in the chair for longer than 30 - 40 minutes without taking a break! Maybe its just me? IDK
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: Love this chair!!!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased mostly for posture improvement and slight lower back pain. The pain is basically gone when I am at the PC. I feel much more comfortable sitting and my body has a different alignment. Whoo, hoo! I understood the concept of the design of the chair but I have never seen parts labeled that way these were. I missed the fact that there were three different types of screws. I admit; I did not read the directions closely and did not have my glasses on at the time. Once the product was put together adjustment of the seat and height of the chair came easy. Thanks so much
customer_reviews.author: Meagan Kolb

customer_reviews.title: A great way to stop slouching.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this due to an injury with my hamstring which made my old office chair painful. This one is much better as it keeps my back straight, forces me to get up at least once an hour and being Catholic kneeling all day helps with penance. OK, that last bit was a joke, but I do find I am less tired and sore after a day in this chair compared to a regular office chair.
customer_reviews.author: Outskiing

customer_reviews.title: Good quality chair
customer_reviews.text: The description of the chair is accurate. I just assembled by myself and it took close to 30 mins--I was trying to be quiet so as not to disturb my office mate. I'm just now sitting in the chair and I can tell it's great for keeping good posture--no slouching allowed! I have it at the highest angle, but I wish it was a little taller, making the angle greater behind the knees---it's a little tight for me and I don't want to keep my knees bent so much. You can also sit comfortably by putting your feet on the floor. I'm 5'7". Overall, I'm happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: MB

customer_reviews.title: I love this chair!
customer_reviews.text: I sit for 8 hours per day, my old desk chair was killing my back. This is my first day using it, but I've got to say if you don't like this chair, it's probably because you don't like the whole kneeling design overall, not the fault of this chair. I say this because I've researched these extensively, the reason I went with this one was the substantial amount of cushion compared to the others, and there are several ways you can adjust it to suit you. It's sturdy and well made, I heartily endorse this chair.
customer_reviews.author: Javaphile

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy chair
customer_reviews.text: I work for about 15 hours straight and needed a better option for sitting to avoid the pain in my hip. My PT recommended this type of chair. The one I have is sturdy and looks very nice. I found that my knees were getting rather tired of the pressure of sitting throughout the long day but it was easy to stretch them out periodically. My hip did feel better though. Adjusting the height and angle was a little cumbersome, but once you figure out what suits best that is not really an issue. Overall a good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: C Vaughn

customer_reviews.title: Solid construction and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: While assembly was required, it took less than 10-minutes to complete. The chair is nice looking, well made, and performs well. The padded surfaces are comfortable. The butt cushion could benefit from additional padding, but it's fine for an hour or two. Compared to conventional wood-based kneeling chair designs, this has adjustments and wheels.
customer_reviews.author: GuyFromVA

customer_reviews.title: Eh.
customer_reviews.text: It came with no instructions for putting it together. I found a video on the page for the item that helped but it wasn't ideal, I still put some parts backwards and had to redo it because it wasn't clear in the video. It is narrow enough to fit in the space I intended to use it but I could NOT find a comfortable setting and ended up buying a cheap $40 regular chair that I'm much more comfortable with. But now I'm struck with this $180 chair I can't use! Blah.
customer_reviews.author: oddlittleducks

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Can't write a bad review here. Suggestion: use a material other than partical board for the knee support. That's where most of the weight is. I'm 210, it's rated for 250. I didn't check when I bought this or I would have gotten one rated for 300 or more. I knew it wouldn't hold because any time I leaned to the right, it would creak a little. Didn't last more than 4 days. Shame. If you increased the price by 50usd and gave it hard wood on the seat and knee area I still would have bought it. It's comforting, and a lot better than the old one I had.
customer_reviews.author: Lunareclips3

customer_reviews.title: This saved my back
customer_reviews.text: Like many of you I had to start working from home in March, I don't have a big house so the dinning room became my office and I have kids I needed to home school, after one week my back was screaming. Not only is this chair comfortable and highly adjustable, but you can get in and out easily to go see what chaos your children/dogs/neighbors are committing. I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: JoyO

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: Good quality. Easy to put together. I swap out between this chair and a yoga ball chair all day. I purchased to help with posture / long hours at a desk / typing. It has been helping with my tendinitis. I do have a tendency to slide down the seat but that serves as a reminder to pay attention to my posture and correct myself. My legs do grow tired/ numb if I sit in this position for more than a few hours. But that’s why I swap out. Would definitely recommend and buy another for outside my home office.
customer_reviews.author: KLL

customer_reviews.title: It relieves lower back stress.
customer_reviews.text: The chair definitely makes you sit up straight and relieves the lower back pain. The 2 cushions gives great comfort on the buttocks and lower legs. The chair is definitely well made and sturdy. The rollers make it easy to move around plus brakes are provided to make it stationary. The down side is if you need upper back support, this chair does not provide except creates you to sit with good straight posture. Depending on your mobility, this chair may be difficult to get up and down without some support of a table or desk nearby. It was a great investment for temporary relief of pain when sitting is an issue.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Way Better Than My Old Office Chair
customer_reviews.text: The jury's still out for long-term pain relief, but I think this was a wise choice (hence the 4-stars.) My wife used a similar kneeling chair for years. I figured I had nothing to lose. I've only been using it for several days, but already I'm not stiff or in major back pain when I leave my office after several hours on this chair. The quality is good, the adjustment range is sufficient for me (5' 8"). Assembly took about 5 minutes. I'd definitely recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Lundgren

customer_reviews.title: A good chair
customer_reviews.text: I bought this chair about six months ago because I had a lot of lower back pain from sitting in an office chair so much. This chair has drastically improved the way my back feels. Although it takes a bit to get used to, it is certainly worth it if you stick with it. Also, when I got mine, it was missing a key part, so I could not use it; however, I contacted the company and they had the missing part at my house within 24 hours.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: pretty thick foam pad
customer_reviews.text: It do help me to sit up straight. pretty thick foam pad, and took about 10 minutes to put it together.
customer_reviews.author: layscat

customer_reviews.title: All the hype is true!  Great comfort....preferable to the good ol desk chair!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a gift for my adult son. Also purchase a great executive chair at the same time. The chair sits in the corner....he loves his kneeling chair! He is very health conscious and says it helps his posture and back strain. He is at his desk most of the day and he loves this product. I hesitated to buy because i seems such a radical departure from the normal desk chair....but its a huge success! I tried it myself and was surprised at how comfortable I felt! Great concept....well made product....winner.
customer_reviews.author: wendie

customer_reviews.title: Nerve pain and numbness gone in 2 days.
customer_reviews.text: WOW. Herniated L5-S1 was causing nerve pain in my back and numbness in my hips/legs when seated. I switched to this chair and it's like I'm back to 95%. I'd recommend to anyone. The only reason for 4 star rating instead of 5 star is that the wood-floor casters don't work well (especially when I'm seated in the chair and try to propel myself around with my feet). They're already causing some mild damage to my flooring and I'm having to buy better quality casters. Still.... very thankful for how this chair is already changing my life.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Despain

customer_reviews.title: good product.
customer_reviews.text: It's not the prettiest thing I've ever seen... but my back doesn't hurt any more after 9 and 10 hour work from home days, and I am so grateful. Easy enough to assemble. Sometimes I end up with pressure on my shins and I just get up, walk around a little. Changing the angle of the chair helped a lot too and relieved the weight distribution. Definitely recommend. :)
customer_reviews.author: adllewellyn

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy; Broke after a single use
customer_reviews.text: The cushions are nice and the chair looks nice, but the plywood at the bottom of the kneeler broke after a single use. And to be clear, I am well under the advertised weight limit for the chair AND this is not my first kneeling chair either. I picked this one to replace a cheaper kneeling chair I had bought on Amazon that I had used for a long time until I realized a screw had fallen out of the seat piece. This one is almost double the price of that one, yet the older version of that one has lasted me years. Going back to the cheaper, sturdier kneeling chair and sending this one back.
customer_reviews.author: Adrienne D. Millican

customer_reviews.title: LOVE this chair!!
customer_reviews.text: We loved this chair so much that we bought it in another color! The white color goes better with my office and tucks right under the desk when I'm not using it!
customer_reviews.author: AK

customer_reviews.title: Horrible chair
customer_reviews.text: I figured I would give this chair an honest try and after more than 6 months I am pretty certain that this chair provides no utility, quite the opposite I feel that this chair has exaggerated my back pains. The chair is not comfortable and it is hard to work for a longer period in the position once is in and given that the chair provides very little support you actually get more tired after a longer session. I am very disappointed in this purchase and if I could get my money back I would return this chair immediately. I think next steps for me is to throw this chair out and get a regular computer chair. DON'T BUY!
customer_reviews.author: Rani Ibrahim

customer_reviews.title: Is this a real chair, or is it just fantasy...
customer_reviews.text: I’ve only been using this for one day, but it was a great investment as I am already working more efficiently. I was dreading working at all because I could barely stand to sit in a regular office chair for more than 20 minutes at a time before feeling pain and general fatigue from poor slumped posture. After one day, I’ve been able to sit at my desk for several hours a day without pain. My upper back feels much happier and overall healthier as well, which also helped cut down on my fatigue.
customer_reviews.author: HeatherA

customer_reviews.title: It helps but in a different way
customer_reviews.text: I don't think this chair forces me to use my core muscle when sitting on it, but it makes it easier to leverage my core muscle if I want. The posture may or may not be improved, I am not sure. It helps me because I have to stand up after sitting on it for about 45 minutes as my legs turn numb.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable.  No more back pain.  Front wheels can get stuck.
customer_reviews.text: My daily afternoon back soreness went away completely on day one of using this chair. Legs and knees require getting some used to. But after about a week I feel very adapted to it. Unfortunately the design makes the front casters point forward at an angle, making them difficult to turn directions. Leaning back and putting less weight at the front helps move them. Roller mat recommended for smoother operation. I started using a standing desk so I don't "kneel" on this chair as much. My weight is distributed over my feet, legs, knees, hips, and back differently throughout the day. Highly recommend a combo routine of standing and kneeling (and sitting if you must).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Shopaholic

customer_reviews.title: Great chair but had to send back.  :(
customer_reviews.text: Wanted to keep this chair so bad but just couldn’t. All of my back pain was relieved but unfortunately was transferred to the backs of my knees. The chair is very well made and all of the cushioning is top notch!! I adjusted the chair 3 times trying to get judy the right set up but ultimately had to give up. I’m 5’8” and 138 lbs. such a bummer!!!
customer_reviews.author: Biscuit

customer_reviews.title: Two thumbs from a first-time ergo chair user
customer_reviews.text: High quality, thick padding and sturdy frame. Easy to put together. Great value. I recommend this chair and the concept of ergo chairs in general to people with lower back pain. To my surprise, this is actually way more comfortable than a normal desk chair, because it releases so much tension. I always realized it would force better posture, but I thought you would need to exert a lot of energy to sit in them, like doing a plank or wall sit. Not the case at all. It's just a better way to sit. Why didn't I start using these kinds of chairs this sooner?
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Not perfect--for me
customer_reviews.text: I was having a problem with sciatica and wanted to take the pressure off my thighs. That is accomplished, but now my knees are uncomfortable. There is plenty of padding and it's nice a squishy. I weight 128 so it's not like I'm heavy. The biggest problem is that there's no way to lower it without taking off the casters. I have been doing my computer work on a table and the kneeling chair is way too high. Now I'm going to have to change my whole office to put the computer on my writing desk or find some kind of stand for desktop and keyboards! I'm tempted to send it back.
customer_reviews.author: A. Sullivan

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I got this chair because I tend to sit on my legs, and I know it's not great for circulation. So when I saw this, I thought it would be a perfect fit. It so is! The design is comfortable, adjustable if you find your legs don't fit right the first time, and more intuitive to my seating style than I imagined. It has taken a little back and forth for me to build up the strength to keep the position, and I sometimes still switch out with my old chair, but I'm very pleased with this style and setup. So glad I didn't go for one with a backrest like I originally thought I wanted.
customer_reviews.author: Angel Leya

customer_reviews.title: Exceptional comfort, easy assembly and alleviates back pain!
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent kneeling chair. Exceptional padding for knees and seat, easy to assemble, and has alleviated my lower back pain considerably. It is also very nice looking. I highly recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: E

customer_reviews.title: If you haven't finished your engineering degree, now's the time, before you try to assemble this.
customer_reviews.text: This now takes the number one spot on my list of poor instructions.. Wait -- there were no instructions. I received an extremely poorly drawn picture of where the bolts go. But the number of hole options in the frame don't match the drawing. There was no explanation for how to adjust the chair (if indeed you can) or what to do if the space where you are to put your legs doesn't match the length of your legs. Trial and error, my friends! I put this **** chair together three times before I got it usable. Great concept, and I've used other brands of kneeling chairs that were comfortable, but this is not one of them.
customer_reviews.author: J Ellyson

customer_reviews.title: Still very new but seems well built
customer_reviews.text: I needed a chair to help relieve pain in my hip. I prefer to stand but it’s not feasible to do this 8+ hrs a day. Back in the 90’s I had a kneeling chair and loved it so I thought I would give it a try. It assembled easy, changes to configurations is not simple but not too hard either. So far it was a good decision.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah Davis

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I was looking for!
customer_reviews.text: This kneeling chair is exactly what I was looking for! Very easy to put together with sturdy, long-lasting materials. I would recommend this product to anyone!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Much more comfortable than I was anticipaing
customer_reviews.text: My physical therapist recommended getting a kneeling chair for my office. I was a bit dubious. I tried one of those balance ball chairs a few years ago and hated it. I didn't think the kneeling chair looked comfortable. I put together the chair today (quite easy to assemble) and I love it. It's surprisingly comfortable. I was concerned that my knees would get sore, but these pads are very cushy. I'm hoping the chair helps with my posture. So far, I am pleased with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Cathy from Montana

customer_reviews.title: The padding looks fit but unconfortable at all
customer_reviews.text: Love the design and its price The padding looks super confortable from the picture, but it's not firm enough. When you seat on this chair, all the padding does not offer any support. It will conpress to so flat that i can feel the wood padding base. What a great disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: SWEIL

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and fits a 6 foot guy
customer_reviews.text: This is the first chair of this type I've ever owned and it has worked well so far. It's a little bit high for a standard desk, but I'm not sure I could fit my legs under my body in a much more compact way. I'm about 6 feet tall so I have long legs. My butt tends to sit all the way on the upper seat rather than in the middle like most pictures show, but it still puts weight on my legs which is what I want. I would recommend it for people looking for this type of chair. It has definitely helped with my lower back pain which was the original reason I purchased it.
customer_reviews.author: Hilltop

customer_reviews.title: Not suitable for long durations!
customer_reviews.text: I always wanted to try this type of chair as I get lower back pain sitting all day and naturaly fold my legs back on regular chairs. This definitely does eliminate back pain but now I have extreme knee/shin pain. I read to give it time for my body to adjust but it’s been 3months and I’ve tried all three knee pad settings and played with the height and it is not suitable for all day use in an 8-hr shift.
customer_reviews.author: Drew

customer_reviews.title: Adjusts enough so I don’t have to be in pain when I sit.
customer_reviews.text: It seems to be working for me. I have scar tissue on my sit-bone so sitting on a regular chair, seat etc is very painful. I can adjust this chair so I’m not sitting directly on that area.
customer_reviews.author: Ken & Gloria

customer_reviews.title: Chronic back pain gone
customer_reviews.text: I sit a lot for work, but it’s always painful and uncomfortable. I’ve switched chairs added supports you name it. This is the first chair I’ve sat in for long periods and not felt ANY back pain. There is some discomfort on my shins from the sitting position but that’s already starting to go away. I LOVE this chair!
customer_reviews.author: HalleyBelle

customer_reviews.title: Back feels so much better!
customer_reviews.text: Love this chair. I was especially surprised that wheels enabled you to move in all directions because the pictures make it look like it only goes forward and back. Works great on my carpeted floor.
customer_reviews.author: Page

customer_reviews.title: Great chair
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace a worn out computer chair. I sit for long periods for work. I read reviews and tried this. Much less back pain with using this chair. Did take some getting used to but used this one exclusively after about two weeks. I really like this chair.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not the chair I had hoped for
customer_reviews.text: This chair hurts your knees So badly! Something is different than the other ergonomic chair I had. It’s very disappointing. I have tried lowering and higher oh then chair and it doesn’t work. I don’t think the quality of the chair is worth the price. Sorry!
customer_reviews.author: amamzon0221

customer_reviews.title: Takes a little getting used to but well worth the effort
customer_reviews.text: Love it! It definitely helps me keep my spine more straight and therefore have less pain in the lower back. Compared to a normal chair it also reduces the pressure on a man’s prostrate which probably reduces problems in that area as you age. The padding is really thick but it does cause a little pain in my shins. I think I have to shift around periodically to support myself more with the knees and less on the shins.
customer_reviews.author: dvbssman

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy but slippery!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought two - one for my husband; the other for myself. We had a similar design from a different brand. We really like the overall look of the DRAGONN Ergonomic Kneeling Chair but staying comfortably on the chair is proving to be a challenge. It is slippery which means we have to constantly adjust our positions. One other challenge is "how" you have to get off the chair and turn it over to adjust the height. Our old model had a knob that you only needed to turn to adjust the height. With a few modifications and "tweaks" this could be an outstanding chair!
customer_reviews.author: Maria A.

customer_reviews.title: Helped with My posture
customer_reviews.text: I am taking dance lessons and have been told by my dance instructors, for about year now, to improve my posture so that I can dance with better balance by standing erect. Because it was uncomfortable to hold myself erect, I realized that I needed to retrain myself to sit up straight. This product does the trick. It does take a couple of days to adjust to sitting with pressure on my shins, but it is not an uncomfortable process; just a bit strange. I have already noticed a difference and stand more erect even though I have only had the chair for a short time.
customer_reviews.author: Greg H.

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: Haven't sat in it much, but I am able to sit in it for extended periods of time. My shins do get a little sore after a bit but I am able to just move one foot out like normal to relieve the pain and still sit on the chair (hard to explain how I sit!) Overall it is a fantastic chair, forces me to sit up straight most of the time. I still somehow manage to slouch a little bit but it is uncomfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Greg Allen

customer_reviews.title: New chair
customer_reviews.text: Bought for back relief as normal chair does not get your back in the right position working at a desk for hours. So 1-2 hours worked great...but after two hours painful on the knees even after going for walk etc so great short term but not a replacement for a chair if working in an office all day. I now switch between the two, which helps
customer_reviews.author: J. NORRIS

customer_reviews.title: Hard to maneuver, plus shin pain
customer_reviews.text: Many years ago I had a non-wheeled version of this type of chair and found it to be very comfortable. Not sure why this one was such a pain-in-the-shins, but I couldn't stay in it for more than an hour without serious discomfort. In addition, the 4-wheel design is terrible, you have to fight the wheels every time you make any small adjustments. If I had kept it, I would have pulled the wheels off all together, but it wasn't worth it -- has been returned.
customer_reviews.author: NewMoonRising

customer_reviews.title: Fingers crossed no more pain!
customer_reviews.text: I'm excited for this chair! Hoping it solves my back pain. The instructions were pretty easy. My box came missing 2 screws and 2 washers but Amazon did a great job about fixing the situation. It looks attractive. Sits much higher than I thought!
customer_reviews.author: Ann Harlan

customer_reviews.title: It hurts my butt
customer_reviews.text: It was not as comfortable as I expected. It will make your back straight or overarch to the point it hurts your back. I guess it's better than having turtle or hunchback, but the opposite extreme can also hurt your back. The worst part of the chair is the cushion. It hurts my butt. If you sit more than 30 min, I don't recommend this chair.
customer_reviews.author: nothappy

customer_reviews.title: Highly overpriced
customer_reviews.text: Overall it is not too bad chair but highly overpriced. For about $110 you’ll get chip fake leather that’ll start to peel off in about year of occasional use. The construction overall is flimsy by design and screwing bolts tight doesn’t help. As for comfort: Your back tends to be more straight with this chair which is good. You should stand up at least every 20-30 minutes and walk to rest from this chair for your comfort. Otherwise you’ll feel your legs numb and tingling. I would rate this chair 4 stars if it cost was about $40.
customer_reviews.author: Dmytro Sydorchenko

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, easy to assemble desk chair
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product more for improving my posture at the computer than for back pain relief. I am quite happy with it. It feels much better to sit up properly (as the design encourages) than to slouch, as one is inclined to do after some time at the keyboard. Overall, a quality product.
customer_reviews.author: Emily Jefferson

customer_reviews.title: Missing wheels
customer_reviews.text: Just got the chair today, we assembled it and looks good overall, good construction and feels sturdy, we’ll see how it goes after some time of using it. The reason I’m rating 3 stars it’s because the wheels didn’t come in the package, there’s nothing worst than not being able to finish your build because there are missing pieces, we are disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Elias Vicario

customer_reviews.title: In order to change height or angle, you have to work
customer_reviews.text: Not easy to change height and angle, you have to pull the chair upside down on the floor and play with screws....... Like, really? 2018 anyone? What about an easy handle to do that supposed-to-be-an-easy-task task? The wheels don't roll easily. Generally it's a nice idea, but don't think you are about to get something "luxurious" or anything close, they cut corners. After buying this I'm not sure all reviews here are real. Price is really too much for what you get.
customer_reviews.author: Em

customer_reviews.title: I guess my thighs are too long
customer_reviews.text: Its sturdy and the foam is comfortable, but even extended as far as it can go, my but hangs over the edge. It makes for an uncomfortable seated position. If only it was two or three inches longer, I think it would be fine. I'm 5'11" and I think the tallest person they recommend for it is 6'. So, if you are close to 6', I'd recommend against. If you are about 5'8" or shorter, it will probably be fine.
customer_reviews.author: Don S. Satow

customer_reviews.title: Takes some getting used to, but great once you do
customer_reviews.text: Great chair for the price. Takes a little getting used to (the pressure on your knees can be a little unexpected at first, but you will eventually adjust to the difference). It is also a chair that will passively promote better posture as you're much more aware of your core alignment when using it. In all, it's a different way of sitting and with that comes a certain level of acclimatization that is necessary...but once you get past that, it makes a great alternative to a "normal" chair.
customer_reviews.author: Gareth Hewes

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: One always takes a chance ordering something as important as a desk chair online. I got two of these for a new home office, and both my husband and I think they are great. They are sleek, fit nicely under our desks, and are a great design and comfortable. As advertised, the cushions are very thick. We are extremely happy with this purchase - which is a great value.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Love This Chair!
customer_reviews.text: Since I work at my desk all day, I'm always looking for something to help my lower back. Although it looks a bit odd at first, this chair is AWESOME! It even works for my husband, who is very tall. I recommend it to anyone with a desk job or lower back issues!
customer_reviews.author: AK

customer_reviews.title: Takes Stress off His Back
customer_reviews.text: My husband has to spend much of his day at his computer. A couple years ago he tried a standing desk, but that still made his back and neck sore after too many hours. He is hoping this kneeling chair will be the solution, because spending less time in front of the computer is not an option. So far he loves his new chair. Thanks.
customer_reviews.author: B. DeVries

customer_reviews.title: Simple to put together and use!
customer_reviews.text: Started working full time from home and threw my back out in only two weeks on my little office chair. Got this today and I can already feel how much more comfortable my back feels. Doesn't hurt my knees at all. Will post an update after I use it for a while.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I needed!
customer_reviews.text: I have lower and upper back issues and was directed to use a standing desk. However, I have foot and knee issues as well so standing can get uncomfortable. One day I was kneeling on the floor with my desk lowered and realized that a kneeling chair would be a great alternative to sitting or standing. I had one back in the 80s and loved it. After some research, this seemed to be the best price/feature combination. I have used it for only two days but it is has helped tremendously so far.
customer_reviews.author: Toto de Tejas

customer_reviews.title: Cheap feeling material and poor caster wheels
customer_reviews.text: I used a kneeling chair like this at work for years and loved it. I bought this one for my home office and chose it because it was highly rated and was designated "Amazon's Choice." Within a day of using it, I'm going to have to return. As other reviews noted, the casters are almost not functional at all if you have the chair in a lower position. If you crank the chair up, the casters function better, but still not good enough on my hard wood floor. The chair is also too high in that position to be practical for my 30" tall desk. Additionally, the black leather-like material feels very cheap and plastic-y.
customer_reviews.author: J. B. Downey

customer_reviews.title: A sturdy chair that promotes good posture
customer_reviews.text: I bought this chair for my 6' 1" boyfriend. As a hockey player with muscular thighs, it was important to find a chair that would accommodate his frame comfortably and encourage good posture. I put the chair together myself, and discovered you shouldn't tighten anything on the frame until you have it all together. I now need to save up and buy the same chair for myself. It's thickly padded, easy to adjust, and very comfortable to sit for long periods of time.
customer_reviews.author: Donna M.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent back alignment
customer_reviews.text: I've had a kneeling chair a decade ago, for use prior to a back operation. The kneeling position eased the pain in every way. Having had a successful operation, I passed the chair along to someone in need. Ten years later I'm on my way to the neurosurgeon again. During the wait I bought the Dragonn, and it has helped greatly during this period. It's not hard to put together and I've found the appropriate height. It puts the weight on my thighs instead of my back and eases the spine pressure. Great chair.
customer_reviews.author: mainebythesea

customer_reviews.title: The chair was fairly easy to assemble and seems
customer_reviews.text: The last piece in my ergonomic set-up. The chair was fairly easy to assemble and seems, so far, to help my posture. After using it for awhile, I can say it has lived up to my expectations. Perfect accompaniment to my sit-stand workstation!
customer_reviews.author: Penny R. Henderson

customer_reviews.title: Broken seat
customer_reviews.text: Had this product for a few months and I can't use it anymore. When it arrived I had trouble assembling the seat since the holes for the screws seemed misaligned. Fast forward to a few months later and all but one of the screws for the seat have fallen out and cannot be put back in. I wish I could give this product a better review since it was so comfortable the few months I was able to use it. I'm not sure if I received a defective product or it just wasn't manufactured well.
customer_reviews.author: Megan Gallegos

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable kneeling chair
customer_reviews.text: The product arrived on time and well packaged. Assembly was easy (prior experience with Ikea furniture likely helped). The chair is very comfortable and I now use it pretty much all day instead of my regular office chair. It is height adjustable, but changing height is a bit more tedious than with other similar kneeling chairs I have used. It was also not explained in the assembly instructions that you have to decide on seat height before finishing the assembly (as far as I can tell), but that is really my only minor criticism.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Silke Hecht

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble, Great for all heights.
customer_reviews.text: I felt the need to find a chair that matched the way I like to sit. This chair was easy to assemble and is great for someone who is 5'1". I noticed that there are several height options when you assemble it, so it can be adjusted for various heights. Very comfortable and study.
customer_reviews.author: Jaclynfre

customer_reviews.title: Comfy and light
customer_reviews.text: I love that it was assembled for me through Amazon's partners , Silent Labors. Max Robinson did a great job. The chair is very comfortable. My knees are well padded. I notice that my keyboard position is better because of the support my back gets. Very good design. PS I'm 5' 2" and it fits me great.
customer_reviews.author: Yoga by Dayna

customer_reviews.title: Posture Promoter
customer_reviews.text: I got one question for you, you want to improve your posture? If yes, then look no further, this chair is a back-saver...literally! Coming home after working on my feet for 12 hour shifts on the unit, the first thing I look to do is sit down. This chair allows for just that while also promoting better posture and core-strengthing spine-alignment. Seats with backs on them are so 90's - so get with the times and get yourself an ergonomic kneeling chair. Your back will thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Mystique

customer_reviews.title: You still need to move around, this wont prevent that need!
customer_reviews.text: I liked how easy this product was to put together. I have since changed the distances slightly to test if the new position felt better than the old one. I'm using this chair on and off in my home office to be honest. For long periods of sitting, I'm doing the terrible thing and using my old chair instead of kneeling with this one. But I am committing to using it while doing most work. Overall, I am happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Russell Edwards

customer_reviews.title: Eliminated my back pain!
customer_reviews.text: I just received this chair and already it has made a huge difference in my back pain. I was at the point where I could only sit comfortably for short periods without back pain. Kneeling in this chair has eliminated my discomfort. I recommend this for anyone who has back trouble, or has trouble sitting for long periods at a time.
customer_reviews.author: Betsy Leonhard

customer_reviews.title: DON'T BUY!!
customer_reviews.text: This product is a Law suit waiting to happen. This is coming from someone who bought this who has two bulging disc in her lower back. My husband assembled it and the 1ST time i kneel on it it broke the cheap ass wood under the cushion. Husband replaced the wood with a thicker piece of wood and stapled the cushion back on. May I recommend a suggestion pay a little more for a better quality kneeling chair. This chair is wayy over price. It's not comfortable to kneel on all day. The reviews bogus and are full of Lies!
customer_reviews.author: Diane Stokes

customer_reviews.title: Well-priced and Ergonomically Wonderful
customer_reviews.text: This little piece of furniture has taken the pain out of sitting and pretty much changed my attitude and my life. It's great for my back and lets me work and read long into the evening without wanting to cry. I love it! Once in a while I feel like I'd like to add a piece of foam to the knee pads- when the shins start to whine.
customer_reviews.author: Susana R.

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful meditation chair!
customer_reviews.text: The best kneeling chair I've had in a long time; wish I'd gotten it sooner. It was easy to assemble. I use it primarily for meditation instead of sitting on cushions, and it keeps my spine straight without effort. I also use it at my desk and it works well there too. Couldn't be happier. I highly recommend this chair.
customer_reviews.author: iamlina

customer_reviews.title: Great chair for your back.
customer_reviews.text: This chair was simple to put together. Very comfortable to use and your back will be very happy. The color is beautifully white. The pleather is nice.
customer_reviews.author: Philip E. Madrid

customer_reviews.title: One of the smartest decisions I've made for office furniture
customer_reviews.text: Love, love, love this chair. I was starting to have constant pain in my lower back. I've had this chair about a week. I have no pain in my lower back now.
customer_reviews.author: Teej

customer_reviews.title: Great so far
customer_reviews.text: So far so good and I definitely found relief in my lower back since it did correct my posture. Yes, over an 8-9 hr day you'll have to adjust your position cause you can't put all the pressure on your knees all the time but I can def say it's helped with my lower back problems. I did have to buy some monitor height adjusters so I would keep my upper back posture straight as well.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: Helps with lower back pain
customer_reviews.text: I've had lower back pain, on and off for years. This chair makes me use better posture when working at my desk. (Sometimes I'm in a project ans sitting for 4 hours at a time.) I recommend coupling this with a fitbit or pedometer watch. If you use the chair and get up and walk every hour or so your back will probably feel better. Mine has.
customer_reviews.author: Martin

customer_reviews.title: Takes getting used to but worth it!
customer_reviews.text: This chair was a lifesaver. I work from home and spend most of my day at a desk, I was having some pretty decent lower back pain from my chair and noticed my posture suffering. I started looking for a better option and found this chair. I was a but skeptical but I'm really happy I gave it a shot. It took about a week to get used to and for my core muscles to adjust but even during that time I noticed it was more muscle soreness as opposed to spinal pain. Now I absolutely love it!
customer_reviews.author: C & J

product_meta.title: DRAGONN (by VIVO) Ergonomic Kneeling Chair, Adjustable Stool for Home and Office - Improve Your Posture with an Angled Seat - Thick Comfortable Cushions, Black (DN-CH-K01B)
feature_bullets: ERGONOMIC OFFICE CHAIR - We’ve got your back (and your knees, shins, and your behind!) Your ergonomic kneeling chair with back support is equipped with a mesh three-inch thick cushion to ensure excellent support. It features 4 casters (wheels) so you have the freedom to move – just like your old office chair! PLEASE NOTE: You will use different muscles in a kneeling chair, so it’s best to acclimate yourself when first using or switch positions throughout the day.

BETTER POSTURE WITH TILTED SEAT - There is no reason to hunch over your keyboard or desk for hours on end anymore. This posture chair has a functional design that gives you the posture benefits of standing and the relief of sitting all in one. It will keep your back at an upright position, distributing your weight evenly throughout your buttocks and legs, all while keeping your spine aligned.
HEAVY DUTY - This ergonomic kneeling stool is designed with a strong metal base and is constructed to last. Your new rolling kneeling chair supports up to 250 lbs.
MODERN DESIGN - With a sleek all black style – your new kneeling stool is perfect fit for your home, office, classroom, or anywhere you need a little extra support!

HEIGHT ADJUSTABLE - You can adjust the DRAGONN chair to the size that suits you. It ranges from 21" to 31", allowing you to find the perfect position. Once you sit in our ergonomic chair, you will wonder why you didn't get this earlier.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.0 out of 5 stars1,156 ratings4.0 out of 5 stars
